Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery open vase, probably a krater or dinos. Goat and sphinx or panther facing. Remaining are the neck, horns, and shoulder of the goat, the shoulder, a bit of the neck, and the upraised leg(?) of the sphinx or panther. Added red on the neck of both creatures.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 95 no. 330 pl. 71)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1185)
